June 30, 1959
Mias Mary Field
ABC Television Limited
1 Hanover Square
London, W* 1, England
Dear Miss Field*
Thank you for your letter of June 23 and your kind cements about
the report of the seminar*
You will be interested to know that the NAE8 is undertaking a two-
year project on the "language of the media," under the direction of
Dr. Marshall McLuhan of the University of Tor cm to. This project was
made possible by a grant from the U. S. Office of Education under
the provisions of the national Defense Education Act, and will
attempt to explore how people are affected by the medium itself as
separate from the message being transmitted by the particular medium.
In other words, we know pretty well how people react to the printed
word and we have courses in teaching them to read properly and well,
but we do not know what effect the medium of television has upon
people, or how they will react differently to the same message over
television simply because that is the medium used* And any attempts
at teaching people how to view TV properly are very limited and weak
at best. It is very difficult adequately to explain this project in
a few sentences (especially when it took several pages of explanation
in the proposal we submitted to the U. S. Office of Education), but
I'm sure you get the idea.
At any rate, knowing of your interest in this sort of thing and
feeling that there might be considerable connection between your
proposed studies and this project, I have taken the liberty of passing
your name an to Dr. McLuhan and suggesting that he get in touch with
you. I expect that you will hear from him sometime soon.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
